page.title: 04Music Workshop,Wantage.
page.content: The Music Workshop was started in September 1974 to give people learning musical instruments the opportunity to play together in small groups. Oxfordshire County Council allow the use of Icknield Hall,Wantage School on Saturday mornings.At present 70 children and 15 adults attend.There are 12 instructors. Activities include lessons on the guitar,recorder,violin,saxophone,French Horn,trumpet and trombone.After a break we make music in groups.We call this "scrape,bang and blow" There are two choirs as well as solo singing,a wind band and ensembles for woodwind,guitars saxophones and recorders. Dramatic productions, such as "Noye's Fludde" by Benjamin Britten, are produced and performed for parents and friends.
